title: Mango Chutney
steps: Heat oil over medium-high in a medium stock pot.
Sauté ginger, garlic, and red chilies for 1 minute.
Add nigella seeds, coriander, cumin, turmeric, cardamom, cloves, and cinnamon. Sauté for another minute.
Add diced mangoes, sugar, salt, and vinegar. Stir to combine.
Bring to a rapid boil, then reduce heat to medium-low.
Simmer steadily for 1 hour, stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat and allow to cool.
If you prefer smaller chunks, use a potato masher to mash the mixture to desired consistency.
Store in sealed jars in refrigerator for up to 2 months, or freeze for several months.
For best results, let chutney sit for a few days before using to allow flavors to develop and mellow.
notes: Volume conversions: 1 tbsp oil ≈ 14g, 2 tsp ginger ≈ 8g, 2 cloves garlic ≈ 10g, 2 tsp nigella seeds ≈ 6g, 1 tsp coriander ≈ 3g, ½ tsp cumin ≈ 2g, spices ≈ 2g each, 5 large mangoes ≈ 1500g total, 2 cups sugar ≈ 400g, 1 cup vinegar ≈ 240g
Nigella seeds are optional but highly recommended for incredible flavor
Remove chili seeds and membrane for less heat
Canning instructions: Pour hot mixture into sterilized jars and process in water bath for 10 minutes. Store in dark, cool place for at least 1 year
